Comments_List: An overview of statistical methods of neuroimaging data.

This course was great at building a bridge between common statistical tests and their practical application in the field of neuroimaging. In addition there were discussion around state of the art neuroimaging analyses that gave insight into the current state of the field.

The course is well-organized and the contents are interesting. Wide coverage of the state-of-art techniques in fMRI although due to time-limit we cannot delve deeper into the machine learning contents.
The materials selection is very good. It could be better to include more statistical background for each chapter.
This course was very good at giving an intuition about statistical tests commonly used in neuroimaging. I think it could be improved by having a portion of the class be a lab-style arrangement.
Yes. The course is a good review of the current contents in fMRI research.
Yes, to those who are interested in neuroimaging data analysis.
Yes, if you have experience in neuroimaging and/or stats and want to learn how to bridge them
I would recommend this class to anyone who does neuroimaging based research, or is interested in getting into it.
